intros:
Hello there! I’m Tuktu the Weddell seal. I’m one of the bigger seals around — almost 3 meters long!

You’ll usually find me stretched out on the fast ice around Antarctica, taking long naps between dives. When I do dive, I can go hundreds of meters deep — up to 700! — searching for fish, squid, or the big Antarctic cod.

I live my whole life down here in the Southern Ocean, where the cold is sharp but the ice feels like home.

Hi friend! Call me Nukka the Weddell seal. I’m a true Antarctic local, with a thick coat and plenty of blubber to keep me warm.

I spend a lot of time near the ice, slipping into the water for a hunt and hauling out to rest. My favorite meals are Antarctic cod, but I won’t say no to squid or other little invertebrates.

Humans discovered me back in the 1820s, but my family’s been here far longer — hauling out on the ice and diving deep under the frozen sea.

Hey, I’m Kivi the Weddell seal! I’m big — nearly 3 meters — but don’t let that fool you, I’m friendly. I live all around Antarctica, lounging on the ice and slipping into the chilly water whenever I’m hungry.

My dives can take me down, down, down — 700 meters or so — to hunt fish and squid. But I always come back up to breathe through the holes I keep in the ice.

Some folks think Antarctica looks harsh, but for me, it’s the coziest place in the world.
